Comment: The fact that it's difficult to discharge student loans through bankruptcy is what keeps the interest rates so low. Without that feature rates would be much much higher and more, perhaps *most*, former students taking advantage of them would be forced to declare bankruptcy.   The problem is not the banks. The problem is that we have a system that only works when the country has jobs with salaries high enough to live a middle class lifestyle while paying off significant student debt available for the people coming out of college every year. And America is no longer that country.   We need to either go back to having the government itself guarantee the loans (or issue the loans itself) or drastically reducing access to college for working class kids.
